definition: national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to have a sense of shame
to take revenge for a past insult/to expunge a disgrace or humiliation
to have no sense of shame
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
to have no sense of shame/brazen

sentences.english: Out of date from the combination of wandering to, shame more eastward Jun beg.
sentences.chinese: 過時自合飄零去，恥向東君更乞憐。

sentences.english: And rather than be chagrined by her own behaviour , she makes threats .
sentences.chinese: 她不以自己的行爲爲恥，反而威脅你。

sentences.english: "I am not ashamed of the gospel," Paul told the Romans.
sentences.chinese: “我不以福音爲恥”，保羅這樣對羅馬人說。

sentences.english: Team work as glory, Mutual hurt as shame.
sentences.chinese: 以團結協作爲榮，以彼此拆臺爲恥。

sentences.english: Don't be ashamed to seek help.
Live plainly, struggle hard, do not wallow in luxuries and pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 以艱苦奮鬥爲榮，以嬌奢淫逸爲恥。

sentences.english: Ignorance is not a shame but unwilling to learn.
sentences.chinese: 無知不爲恥，不想學纔可恥。

sentences.english: Serve, do not disserve the human.
sentences.chinese: 以服務人民爲榮，已背離人民爲恥。

sentences.english: To one shot headshot buttoned proud to light each other's bullets did not die ashamed.
sentences.chinese: 以一槍爆頭搞定爲榮，以子彈用光對方沒死爲恥。

sentences.english: Objective To study the clinical characteristics, prognosis, therapy and route transmission for ocular infection of children with pthirus pubis .
sentences.chinese: 目的瞭解兒童眼部恥陰蝨寄生的臨牀表現和傳播途徑。

sentences.english: David and others were quite honest and unashamed in telling us about their tears.
sentences.chinese: 大衛和其他人坦白承認他們流淚，並不以流淚爲恥。

sentences.english: Thousands of years of history. The newspaper nameless, a heart of pure loyalty.
sentences.chinese: 千年史冊恥無名，一片丹心報天子。

sentences.english: Great State Boxer Protocol shame, become a semi-feudal society.
sentences.chinese: 辛丑條約國大恥，社會淪爲半封建。

definition: prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to put (a criminal) to death/to punish
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
